comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: In Oct 1913, a Lucille Singleton, who claimed to to be the 19-yr-old daughter of a Texan mine owner, was involved in a bizarre incident in which her companion (who appears to have given a false name) stabbed her in a jealous rage and crashed the car he was driving -- and in which she was a passenger!! See The Ogden standard., October 02, 1913, 4 o'clock p.m. City Edition, Page 5, Col 1. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85058396/1913-10-02/ed-... The NYT of October 4, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0611F73A5F13738... indicated that charges would be dropped. She admitted to being drunk.
